alert.note: Alert for Davidson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 31 at 5:11PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A line of showers and isolated thunderstorms will impact portions of Davidson, Anson, Montgomery, Randolph, Stanly and Guilford Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 508 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of showers and isolated thunderstorms extending from Denton to High Point to Greensboro, moving northeast at 35 mph. The isolated thunderstorms were located near Badin and Denton were producing brief heavy rainfall and gusty winds to 30 mph. Areas of locally heavy rain were falling all along the line of showers. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Greensboro, High Point, Asheboro, Lexington, Albemarle, Wadesboro, Randleman, Troy, Badin Lake and North Carolina Zoo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Brief heavy rainfall is also occurring may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
